topic: Deep dive: _csv standard library module in Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: Deep dive: _csv standard library module in Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Deep Dive: csv Standard Library Module in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer delves into the enhancements and notable features of the csv standard library module in Python 3.12+. It covers improved performance, new writer classes, and other updates.
key_points: Improved Performance: The csv module has been optimized for better efficiency in reading and writing large CSV files.
New Writer Classes: Introduced are the DictWriter and DictReader classes, which allow for easier handling of dictionaries instead of lists.
Line Preview: Now possible to preview lines before they're written using the newliner parameter in writer methods.
Quote Characters: Support for custom quote characters has been added for better flexibility when dealing with special cases.

code_examples.code:
import csv
with open('myfile.csv', 'w', newline='') as f:
    writer = csv.DictWriter(f, fieldnames=['name', 'age'])
    writer.writeheader()
    writer.writerow({'name': 'Alice', 'age': 30})

import csv
with open('myfile.csv') as f:
    reader = csv.DictReader(f)
    for row in reader:
        print(row['name'], row['age'])

caveats: When using custom quote characters, ensure that they do not appear in the data or within any quoted fields.
Always remember to close files when finished to prevent potential resource leaks.
